task: A contract states 'Buyer shall pay within 30 days of delivery.' Goods delivered on Jan 1. Payment made on Feb 5. Is this a breach of contract?
Contract clause: 'Seller warrants product free from defects for 12 months.' Product fails after 14 months. Is seller liable?
Employment contract specifies 2 weeks notice for termination. Employee quits immediately. Can employer claim damages?
Lease agreement: 'Tenant responsible for all repairs except structural.' Water heater breaks. Who pays for replacement?
Non-compete clause restricts employee from working in same industry for 3 years within 500 miles. Is this enforceable in most US jurisdictions?
Contract contains force majeure clause listing 'earthquake, flood, war.' Factory destroyed by tornado. Is seller excused from performance?
Confidentiality agreement survives contract termination for 5 years. Contract ended 2020. In 2024, can party disclose information?
Partnership agreement: profits split 60-40. Partner A contributed $100k, Partner B contributed $50k. Company earns $90k profit. How much does Partner A receive?
Indemnification clause: 'Party A indemnifies Party B for third-party claims arising from Party A's negligence.' Third party sues Party B for Party B's negligence. Must Party A indemnify?
Statute of limitations for contract breach is 4 years. Breach occurred Jan 2020. Lawsuit filed Feb 2024. Is claim time-barred?
Arbitration clause requires disputes resolved in New York under AAA rules. Can party file lawsuit in California state court?
Liquidated damages clause specifies $1,000 per day for late delivery. Actual damages provable at $100/day. Is clause enforceable?
Contract: 'Price subject to adjustment for material cost increases exceeding 10%.' Steel costs increase 8%. Can seller increase price?
Severability clause states: 'If any provision unenforceable, remainder remains valid.' One clause declared illegal. Does entire contract fail?
Assignment clause: 'Neither party may assign without written consent.' Company A merges with Company B. Is this an assignment requiring consent?
Material breach occurs when breach goes to 'root of contract.' Late payment of 2% of invoice. Is this material breach?
Warranty disclaimer: 'As-is, no warranties express or implied.' Product defective. Can buyer claim breach of implied warranty of merchantability?
Contract requires delivery 'on or before Dec 31.' Delivery made Jan 2 due to carrier delay beyond seller's control. Is seller in breach?
Modification clause: 'Contract may only be modified in writing signed by both parties.' Parties orally agree to extend deadline. Is modification binding?
Choice of law provision: 'Governed by laws of Delaware.' Contract performed in Texas. Lawsuit filed in California. Which state's law applies?
Specific performance available when: (1) contract valid, (2) damages inadequate, (3) enforceable terms. Sale of common stock meets criteria?
Contract ambiguity resolved against drafter (contra proferentem). Company drafted contract with ambiguous term. Interpret in whose favor?
Parol evidence rule bars evidence of prior agreements contradicting written contract. Exception for fraud. Prior oral promise contradicts written term. Can evidence be admitted to show fraud?

Unconscionability requires: (1) procedural unfairness in formation, (2) substantive unfairness in terms. Standard form contract with unfair term but parties equally sophisticated. Is contract unconscionable?
Consequential damages must be foreseeable at contract formation. Buyer suffers $100k profit loss from delay. Seller unaware of buyer's resale plans. Are consequential damages recoverable?
Condition precedent: 'Payment due upon satisfactory inspection.' Inspection scheduled but buyer fails to show. Is payment due?
Mutual mistake about basic assumption voids contract. Parties contract to sell 'Peerless' ship, but two ships named Peerless exist. Is contract void?

Promissory estoppel requires: (1) promise, (2) reasonable reliance, (3) injustice without enforcement. Seller promises delivery, buyer declines backup supplier, seller fails to deliver. Does promissory estoppel apply?
Integration clause: 'This writing constitutes entire agreement.' Can party introduce evidence of contemporaneous oral agreement on different subject?
Duty to mitigate damages. Landlord sues for full year's rent after tenant abandons after 2 months. Landlord made no effort to re-rent. Can landlord recover full amount?
